verbs.description: arouse (third-person singular simple present arouses, present participle arousing, simple past and past participle aroused)

examples: to arouse compassion, jealousy, or anger

entries.meaning: (transitive, euphemistic) To cause an erection of the penis or other physical signs of sexual arousal, such as fluid secretion.
examples: I can't wear wool underwear: it tends to arouse me at inappropriate times.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To wake from sleep or stupor; to rouse.
examples: He kenned not whether it was devil or mortal, but flung himself on the roadside and lay like a corp for an hour or more, till the rain aroused him.
